publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7009 Bill Kidd: Drastic Impact of Coalition’s Welfare Cuts on Glasgow City—That the Parliament expresses concern at the findings of the report, People Councils the Economy, An assessment of the impact of proposed changes to the UK Benefits System by the Scottish Local Government Forum Against Poverty, and Rights Advice Scotland, that: "Scotland’s poorest individuals, families and communities will pay a heavy price for successive UK Governments’ decisions to prop-up the collapsing banking and financial services sector and reduce the resultant national deficit by cutting public expenditure, benefits and reforming the welfare system", and in particular notes that Glasgow City will lose around £4 million in Housing Benefit, £43 million in Disability Living Allowance and up to £43 million in Incapacity Benefit, which along with other cuts, could cost Glasgow around £100 million annually. Supported by: John Wilson*, Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*, Kenneth Gibson*, Christine Grahame*
